What are ontologies What is the BSSO Foundry
The Behavioural and Social Sciences Ontology (BSSO) Foundry

What is the BSSO Foundry?

The BSSO foundry is a community of practice and exchange for the development, adoption and use of ontologies in the behavioural and social sciences.

Steering Committee:

William Hogan
Director of Biomedical Informatics and Data Science, University of Florida

Bruce Chorpita
Professor of Clinical Psychology, UCLA

Christine Hunter
Acting Director of the Office of Behavioural and Social Sciences Research, NIH

Geert Crombez
Professor of Health Psychology, Ghent University

Robert West
Emeritus Professor of Health Psychology, University College London

Susan Michie
Director of the Centre for Behaviour Change, University College London

Janna Hastings
Assistant Professor of Medical Knowledge and Decision Support, University of Zurich

How to Join:

- To participate and exchange, join the discussion list at http://groups.google.com/g/bssofoundry/.

- To submit your ontology, create an issue at https://github.com/bssofoundry/bssofoundry.github.io/issues with the description of your project, any relevant publications, and a link to your ontology OWL file.
